schreibung Gleichen Sie hier die Stellenbeschreibung mit Ihrem Profil ab. Anstellungsart Festanstellung Vollzeit &nbsp; Arbeitsort Mannheim &nbsp; Lei
stungen Aus der vollständigen Stellenbeschreibung Firmenevents &nbsp; Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung OSAPIENS – Join us in building a sustainable fu
ture! At osapiens, we are committed to empowering businesses economically while promoting human rights and establishing ecologically sustainable and r
esponsible corporate governance as a global standard. We support global enterprises in over 60 countries in integrating sustainability and positioning
 themselves for the future. To achieve this, we develop comprehensive SaaS solutions that create transparency and sustainable growth across the entire
 value chain, meet ESG requirements, and automate manual processes. Your Mission This Senior IT Consultant role sits within our Operations Efficiency 
team. In this part of the business, our solutions are built to innovate and optimise the efficiency of a company's day-to-day operations. This has thr
ee components: Distribution: Optimise logistics processes, strengthen customer relationships and sales opportunities and reduce a companies environmen
tal impact with our one-stop solution for last-mile distribution. Maintenance: Give a companies maintenance, asset and reliability team the tools and 
information they need to operate digital efficiently, increase asset availability, improve overall equipment effectiveness and TPM while reducing cost
s. Service: All-in-one service management software to maximise resource efficiency, improve first time fix rates, net promotor scores, reduce energy, 
waste and emissions with 360 Field Service Excellence. Your Responsibilities As a Senior IT Consultant at osapiens you will play a critical role in im
plementing our innovative solutions at our customers' sites in the area of maintenance and field service operations. This position demands a combinati
on of functional, technical, and consulting expertise; SAP integration experience is a plus. You will be involved from the initial requirements gather
ing and implementation to post-implementation support, ensuring successful project delivery and customer satisfaction. Project Management: Efficiently
 manage IT projects regarding time, resources, and quality, reporting to Management and the Steering Committee in line with our IT Project Management 
Policies. Business Analysis: Provide expert functional and technical advice on the optimal use of osapiens solutions, and define business requirements
 with the goal of optimally mapping business processes with our standard solution, documenting it in a business blueprint. Implementation: Break down 
the project scope into work items based on the business blueprint, configure the system accordingly, and coordinate any developments with the team. Te
sting Coordination: Coordinate test cycles with our customers throughout the project lifecycle, including integration testing and user acceptance test
ing (UAT). Go Live: Prepare go-live and cut-over activities with the customer, support the go-live process, and orchestrate the hypercare period after
wards. International and Local Projects: Manage both international and local projects with a focus on SAP and non-SAP environments. Your Experience Ed
ucation: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Informatics, Project Management, or a comparable field. Experience: Minimum of 5 years of relevant 
experience in IT Consulting and Project Management, preferably within the supply chain or logistics area. Functional Skills: Knowledge of maintenance,
 field service, or last-mile distribution; knowledge of SAP products is a plus. Technical Skills: Experience with the latest technologies, best practi
ces, and system integration is a plus. Language Skills: C2 level proficiency in German and strong English skills are required. Soft Skills: Excellent 
presentation and communication skills, an open mindset, a passion for working with people, and a positive attitude. Join us for this and more... A pur
pose-driven mission with and for global industry pioneers in tackling complex challenges Room for creativity through collaborative teamwork and an ope
n communication culture Flexibility and team bonding with our hybrid work options Fuel for your growth journey, both personally and professionally Sus
tainable mobility options, promoting eco-friendly commuting solutions Fun team events and outings with our global teams Inspiring workspaces in Mannhe
im and beyond And, of course, free drinks and snacks About us osapiens supports global companies from various industries in establishing sustainabilit
y within their organizations and positioning themselves for the future. To achieve this, we develop holistic Software-as-a-Service solutions that crea
te transparency and sustainable growth along the entire value chain, fulfill legal ESG requirements, and automate manual processes. osapiens aims to n
ot only strengthen companies economically but also we also promote human rights and ecologically sustainable and responsible corporate governance as t
he global standard. We leverage our cloud-based technology platform, the 'osapiens HUB', and innovative technologies such as artificial intelligence t
o help companies seamlessly implement and automate compliance with international and national ESG laws and guidelines, including CSRD, EUDR, and CSDDD
, and to further ensure accountable sustainability reporting. The osapiens HUB is continuously being developed and expanded to accomodate new solution
s for evolving ESG regulations, as well as solutions for improved transparency and efficiency. osapiens was founded in Germany in 2018 and we currentl
y serve over 1,200 customers worldwide. The company is headquartered in Mannheim and has offices in Berlin, Cologne, Munich, Madrid, Paris, Amsterdam 
and London. We employ over 300 people from 60 countries. In 2022, we were honoured to receive the German Founder Award in the 'Rising Star' category.

 your application. Please apply directly through our careers page. ** &nbsp; Diesen Job melden

escription Department: This role sits within the EMEA Digital practice at Alvarez and Marsal. A&M DTS revolves around six core areas of expertise; Dig

cutives from diverse backgrounds, functional experts & highly skilled consultants. Purpose of the Senior Director (SD) role within Business Technology

 Main &nbsp; Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months
 to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details About Salesforce We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the futu
re of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers i
n a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the st
ate of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right
 place. Description Salesforce, the Einstein 1 Platform unifies your data, AI, CRM, development, and security into a single, comprehensive platform. I
t empowers IT, admins, and developers with an extensible AI platform, facilitating fast development of generative apps and automation. We are the fast
est growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Compan
ies to Work for six years running. Salesforce brings together all your data, from any source. Customer 360, our complete suite of products, unites you
r sales, service, marketing, commerce, and IT teams with a single, shared view of customer information. With artificial intelligence integrated across
 all products, Salesforce helps everyone in your company work more productively and better deliver the personalized experiences customers love. The gr
owth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are inspired by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while als
o finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. What
 is a Solution Engineer? Also known as a "Presales Consultant," "Sales Consultant," or “Sales Engineer”, our team is looking for curious candidates wi
th a real passion for technology to join our Solution Engineering team. We are deeply passionate about customer success, our technology, solutions and
 our business. We deliver strategies and solutions that fuel growth by capturing the C-Suite's mind share, budget, and wallet share in every account: 
accelerating new customers, growing big deals and extending the platform. We partner with our sales team to drive new business and help companies reac
h their growth goals. While selling value is our main focus, we intend to engage in discussions around process improvement and best practices to help 
our customers succeed. Our team thrives on collaboration from our diverse professional and educational backgrounds, mentorship and professional develo
pment while maintaining a positive work/life balance through passion, ingenuity, and integrity, fostering a culture of openness and fun! Your role as 
a Senior Solution Engineer The Solution Engineering team is organized into several industry and specialist teams based on industry they are selling in
to, in this case we are looking for a Solution Engineer in our Financial Services team. A typical day of a Solution Consultant consists of the followi
ng: Liaise with your sales counterpart “on eye level” to develop new/existing business or account strategy. Lead discovery sessions with your customer
s to understand/identify pain points as a basis to build an innovative solution based on the Salesforce technology stack. Clearly articulate the benef
its of Salesforce to customers at all levels, examples include; Administration/IT Staff, managers, "C" level executives or board members. Create memor
able positive experiences for your customers, using empathy, story telling, immersive demo techniques, etc. Leverage your technicals skills to build i
nnovative art of the possible demo solutions and establish a trusted relationship to the technical stakeholders on customer side. Orchestrate an exten

scussions/use cases). Have a strong interest in growing your career and participating in our internal training programs and mentorship initiatives. Su
pport the first line manager in coordination resources and administrative tasks like forecast calls or planning sessions Personality Attributes/Experi
ence: This role is perfect for someone who likes to work with people, is able to think strategically, interested in technology / digitalisation, inter
ested in continuous learning and has an understanding of what challenges our Enterprise customers are facing today. Good understanding of the unique b
usiness requirements of large Enterprise customers and industry trends. Ability to translate customers’ needs into a compelling vision and roadmap. Tr
ack record of presales / solution engineering, consultancy, product management or software delivery preferable in a context of complex enterprises. Ex
perience with Salesforce or other leading business applications is preferred. Solid oral, written, presentation, communication and relationship skills

n IBM® Business Automation Workflow (IBM BAW) is a product that allows creating workflow applications to automate your business and thus improve your 
productivity. The workflow capability is also part of IBM® CloudPak for Business Automation, a platform offering that comprises various business autom
ation capabilities that you can use to digitize all aspects of business operations including gaining real-time insight into your business. The develop
ment team in Böblingen is part of IBM’s worldwide business automation organization. Engineers of our team work in an agile development environment, an
d are responsible for the full software development life cycle – ranging from designing and implementing new product features through testing and supp
orting customers world-wide in continuous delivery process. Your Role and Responsibilities Are you planning to study for a Master's degree or are you 
already studying for a Master's degree in a full-time program? Our Master@IBM program combines full-time study with the career opportunities of a glob
al technology company. What are your tasks? Our development teams in Böblingen are looking for a skilled developer with focus on back-end development,
 however, not excluding front-end skills. Your main responsibilities includes designing and implementing new features, optimizing and maintaining exis
ting code, and ensuring the software meets high-quality standards through testing. You also work closely with other teams in the world wide team. What
 do we offer? Financial power from day one - with attractive remuneration. You can choose between 15 or 20 hours per week. Monthly (gross) salary for 
15 / 20 hours per week: Year 1: 995€ / 1,326€ Year 2: 1,298€ / 1,731€ Year 3::1,437€ / 1,916€ In addition, we pay the semester fees and reimburse trav
el expenses to the university in accordance with our guidelines. You will receive an expense allowance of €2,500 for your Master's thesis. IBM offers 
internal training programs and the opportunity to obtain badges and certifications. Personal support from the specialist team and assistance with care
er planning as well as coaching and mentoring round off the package. Sounds exciting? Perfect! Become part of the IBM team and apply now. How can you 
apply? Please submit the following documents - summarized in one PDF file - with your online application: Letter of application clearly stating your m
otivation for IBM and the part-time master's program, as well as your qualifications for the position. Informative CV, including information on extrac
urricular qualifications, activities or social commitment. Bachelor's or diploma certificate and, if applicable, work and internship references. If yo
u do not yet have a grade transcript, please send us your most recent transcript. We expect a grade point average of 2.5 or better. Applicants with a 
degree from a foreign university must submit an individual transcript of records from the Central Office for Foreign Education (ZAB). Applicants from 
non-EU countries must have a valid work permit and residence permit. We look forward to receiving your application! Required Technical and Professiona
l Expertise Strong background in software development - back-end development and/or front-end development Expertise in programming languages such as J
ava and JavaScript as well as Kubernetes and containers. Embrace the challenge of change and constant learning Strong analytical thinking and problem-
solving techniques Very good team player, but also able to work independently Strong communication skills German: fluent Good knowledge in written and

s, Automation, bis zum Internet of Things und Quantum. Dazu gehört auch der Betrieb des ersten IBM Quantencomputers „System One“ auf europäischem Bode

benchmark, and enable disruptive Edge AI solutions on NXP-systems. You will be part of an exciting community that works on state-of-the-art technology

rch (NAS), Mixed-Precision Quantization in the context of NAS, machine learning protection by model watermarking, and others. Responsibilities Archite

ML-compiler frameworks. Align the integration of the developed, adapted, and extended compiler frameworks into NXP’s AI tooling. Communicate and conti
nuously align the development with business line interests and needs Methodological approach for keeping track of state-of-the-art in the relevant fie
lds Strong interaction with NXP partners in business lines and central organizations Your Profile and required competencies University degree: PhD in 
Computer with significant exposure/involvement with Machine Learning, Edge AI, and Embedded Systems 8+ years of experience in software and hardware en
gineering in the industry using standard development tools (e.g., git, bitbucket, unit test driven development, using CI/CD, docker, etc.) Excellent t
rack record of peer-reviewed publications and contributions to embedded machine learning and Edge AI including hardware/software/algo-co-design Shown

ent fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or t
hrough unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as 
part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or pa
yments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information

ndividual groups freely decide whether to meet online, offline or hybrid. After the trial period, team members decide for themselves how much time the
y want to work from the office or home office, depending on their responsibilities. If it is not possible for you to work in the office, e.g. for acce
ssibility reasons, feel free to contact us and we will find a solution. *Diversity* We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of b
ackgrounds, identities and perspectives. Therefore, we encourage you to apply regardless of your background, gender, sexual orientation, age group, ph

e. We still have a long way to go as an organization, but we are actively working to identify and counteract discriminatory structures. How to apply:

ine Führungskompetenz fördern wir mit individuellem Coaching und spezifischen Führungstrainings. Als Teil des weltweiten KPMG-Netzwerks bieten wir Dir
 zahlreiche Karrieremöglichkeiten im In- und Ausland und somit wertvolle Einblicke in die Vielfalt unserer Tätigkeitsbereiche. Vereinbarkeit von Beruf
 und Privatleben Wir sind überzeugt, dass es vor allem Vielfalt und Flexibilität braucht, um Innovationen zu fördern und langfristige Erfolge zu siche
rn. Nur so können wir die besten Ideen entwickeln und wirklich innovative Lösungen finden. Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Home-Working, Zeitkonten und A
uszeiten schaffen wir Räume, um Privat- und Berufsleben miteinander zu vereinbaren. Darüber hinaus unterstützen wir Dich monatlich mit bis zu vier Stu
nden Freistellung für Dein soziales Engagement. Vielfältige Karriereperspektiven Durch regelmäßige Trainings, Workshops und Weiterbildungen entwickels
t Du Deine Fähigkeiten stetig weiter. Zudem fördern wir Berufsexamina sowie berufsbegleitende Master-Studiengänge. Mit unseren Rotationsprogrammen erm
öglichen wir Deinen fachübergreifenden Einsatz. Diese Einblicke in die vielfältigen Aufgabenfelder bei KPMG erweitern Deinen Horizont und fördern Syne
rgien in der Zusammenarbeit. Über KPMG Es gibt gute Gründe für eine Karriere bei KPMG: In unseren Teams arbeiten rund 12.500 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mita
rbeiter an 26 Standorten in Deutschland. Dabei stehen wir für Vielfalt und eine Kultur der gegenseitigen Wertschätzung. Aufgrund dieser diversen und v
ielschichtigen Kompetenzen in unseren Teams können wir interdisziplinär an innovativen Themen arbeiten und gemeinsam auch große Projekte stemmen. Du b
egleitest mit uns unsere Mandantinnen und Mandanten in den Bereichen Wirtschaftsprüfung, Steuerberatung und Consulting, oder agierst hinter den Kuliss
en in Central Services. Wir suchen Talente, die gemeinsam mit uns die Herausforderungen von morgen angehen wollen. Schon gewusst? Wir stellen nicht nu
r Absolventinnen und Absolventen aus dem Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften ein. Auch motivierte Absolventinnen und Absolventen und (Young) Professiona

ständige Stellenbeschreibung About us At Ada, we envision a world where everyone can access healthcare. In one of the biggest challenges facing the wo
rld, we pioneered a new form of artificial intelligence, combining medical knowledge with intelligent technology to empower millions of people to bett
er understand their health. We're proud to support medical doctors and work with leading health systems and global non-profit organizations. We're a d
iversely skilled team representing 55 nationalities, and we're proliferating to achieve our global ambitions for the future of health. This is just th
e beginning. About the role We are seeking a highly proficient and experienced Senior Expert Engineer to join our Architecture Services team. In this 
role, you will contribute to shaping and evolving the overall architecture of our solutions while providing expertise in frontend development. Archite
cture at Ada is a collaborative responsibility which is shared between all the teams at Ada. Ada has a decentralised architecture approach. The respon
sibility does not belong to just one team of architects. Every engineer, team, and group is required to define and evolve the joint architecture toget
her. For this, the architect services team provides leadership, mentorship, guidance, constraints, and tools to facilitate the joint process. You will
 directly work with the leadership team of the group, giving guidance on the future development of Ada's architecture. While not being a member of a m
odule team, you have a hands-on mentality and you are always eager to code to support teams, prototyping, technology evaluation, and tools enabling th
e software development process. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, collaborate with talented profess
ionals, and drive architectural decisions that have a direct impact on improving healthcare outcomes globally. What you'll do Collaborate with cross-f
unctional teams to define and evolve Ada Health's architecture in alignment with business objectives and technical requirements. Lead architectural de
sign discussions, provide technical guidance, and mentor team members to ensure consistency, scalability, and maintainability of the overall system an
d its components. Take ownership of Ada's frontend architecture and, together with engineering teams, develop technical designs for the frontend platf
orm that will enable seamless integration of different Ada modules. Take ownership of critical architectural components, drive architectural initiativ
es, and propose innovative solutions to address complex technical challenges. Review and evaluate architectural proposals, architectural decision reco
rds (ADRs), and technical initiatives to ensure adherence to architectural principles, best practices, and regulatory requirements. Work closely with 
product managers, engineering leads, and stakeholders to prioritize architectural improvements, address technical debt, and support the implementation
 of cross-team product initiatives. Conduct thorough risk assessments and mitigate potential technical risks related to frontend development, architec
ture, and deployment processes. Champion engineering excellence, promote a collaborative engineering culture, and contribute to the continuous improve
ment of engineering practices, code quality, and system performance. Stay abreast of emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in sof
tware architecture, and advocate for their adoption where applicable. What you'll bring Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering
, or a related field. 8+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering with a strong focus on architecture design and development, ideally at l
east three years in a similar leading engineering role. Proven track record of designing and implementing scalable, resilient, and secure distributed 
systems in a production environment. Proven track record of designing and building complex frontend architectures for web and mobile applications, inc
luding single-page applications (SPAs) and progressive web apps (PWAs). Extensive expertise in modern frontend technologies such as JavaScript (ES6+),
 React.js, Vue.js, or Angular, and responsive design principles. Knowledge of our full tech stack (Kotlin, Spring Boot, JVM, MongoDB, Redis, Docker, K
ubernetes, Node.js, Typescript) is a plus. Strong understanding of frontend performance optimization, browser compatibility, and web accessibility sta
ndards (WCAG) to deliver fast, accessible, and inclusive user experiences. Deep expertise in software architecture patterns, design principles, and be
st practices across multiple domains such as microservices, cloud computing, data processing, and API design. Extensive experience with architectural 
tools and methodologies, including architecture decision records (ADRs), architectural reviews, and technical initiatives. Excellent communication ski
lls with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts effectively and influence decision-making at various levels of the organization. Strong 
leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams, foster collaboration, and drive consensus on architectural decision
s. Experience in the healthcare industry or another highly regulated environment is a plus. What's awaiting you at Ada Flexible working hours to maint
ain a healthy work/life balance 28 days holiday, plus Bank holidays to unplug, rest and recharge for our UK employees (30 days plus public holidays in
 Germany) Corporate health insurance and pension scheme (UK) Support to set up your home office space, with the option for a co-working space subscrip
tion for our remote employees Parental benefits (Plus Nursery benefits for the UK) Employee Assistance Programs to help you look after your emotional 
wellbeing and deal with life's challenges Stay active and healthy with a discounted ClassPass membership (or Urban Sports Club membership for our empl
oyees in Germany) Bike Leasing Scheme (Germany) Online Academy for learning and development opportunities At Ada, inclusivity isn't just a goal – it's

l ab. Anstellungsart Festanstellung Vollzeit &nbsp; Arbeitsort Mannheim &nbsp; Leistungen Aus der vollständigen Stellenbeschreibung Firmenevents &nbsp
; Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung OSAPIENS – Join us in building a sustainable future! At osapiens, we are committed to empowering businesses economi
cally while promoting human rights and establishing ecologically sustainable and responsible corporate governance as a global standard. We support glo
bal enterprises in over 60 countries in integrating sustainability and positioning themselves for the future. To achieve this, we develop comprehensiv
e SaaS solutions that create transparency and sustainable growth across the entire value chain, meet ESG requirements, and automate manual processes. 
Your Mission We’re driven by a mission: to help companies grow with corporate sustainability. Within osapiens, we focus on three main offerings: Busin
ess Partner Transparency, Product Transparency and Operations Efficiency. Business Partner Transparency - The osapiens HUB enables companies to fully 
comply with the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act and the Whistleblower Directive, to calculate their corporate carbon footprint and, in the futur
e, to comply with the Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive. Our osapiens HUB enables companies to fully comply with multiple track & trace
 related directives and the Deforestation Regulation, to calculate their product carbon footprint, and, in the future, to comply with the Product Pass
port Directive. Operations Efficiency - Our solutions are built to innovate and optimise the efficiency of a companies day-to-day operations. Your Res
ponsibilities You lead a team, providing guidance, mentorship, and fostering a collaborative work environment You develop, implement, and maintain mac
hine learning models and algorithms for various business applications You apply knowledge of neural networks and classification techniques to solve co
mplex data problems You utilize regression analysis to uncover insights, patterns, and trends within the data You maintain a hands-on approach, active
ly participating in data analysis and modeling You collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data strategies and objectives for the company Yo
ur Experience Proven experience leading a team of Data Scientists Bachelor's or master's degree in business informatics, Computer Science, Data Scienc
e or comparable Multiple years of professional experience in machine learning and data analysis Experience in programming languages for data analysis 
on relational databases (e.g. Python, R, Oracle, Oracle PL/SQL) Expertise in neural networks, classification, and regression analysis Hands-on data sc
ience experience with leadership skills Effective communication and problem-solving abilities Join us for this and more... A purpose-driven mission wi
th and for global industry pioneers in tackling complex challenges Room for creativity through collaborative teamwork and an open communication cultur
e Flexibility and team bonding with our hybrid work options Fuel for your growth journey, both personally and professionally Sustainable mobility opti
ons, promoting eco-friendly commuting solutions Fun team events and outings with our global teams Inspiring workspaces in Mannheim and beyond And, of 
course, free drinks and snacks About us osapiens supports global companies from various industries in establishing sustainability within their organiz
ations and positioning themselves for the future. To achieve this, we develop holistic Software-as-a-Service solutions that create transparency and su
stainable growth along the entire value chain, fulfill legal ESG requirements, and automate manual processes. osapiens aims to not only strengthen com
panies economically but also we also promote human rights and ecologically sustainable and responsible corporate governance as the global standard. We
 leverage our cloud-based technology platform, the 'osapiens HUB', and innovative technologies such as artificial intelligence to help companies seaml
essly implement and automate compliance with international and national ESG laws and guidelines, including CSRD, EUDR, and CSDDD, and to further ensur
e accountable sustainability reporting. The osapiens HUB is continuously being developed and expanded to accomodate new solutions for evolving ESG reg
ulations, as well as solutions for improved transparency and efficiency. osapiens was founded in Germany in 2018 and we currently serve over 1,200 cus
tomers worldwide. The company is headquartered in Mannheim and has offices in Berlin, Cologne, Munich, Madrid, Paris, Amsterdam and London. We employ

portant enabler. Our Digital Research and Development (DRD) organization develops digital solutions for chemical product and application development a
t Covestro. DRD integrates expertise in materials simulation and computational chemistry, laboratory automation, data science, quantum computing and h
igh-performance computing. Data is at the heart of all our R&D activities and its importance will only increase with the advent of artificial intellig

rganization with expertise in data stewardship, data engineering and data governance. For this purpose, we are looking for a Data Engineer (m/f/d) wit

rchitectures (Python, Spark) Preferably, experience with containerization, handling the Linux operating system, especially shell scripting and confide

SG laws and guidelines, including CSRD, EUDR, and CSDDD, and to further ensure accountable sustainability reporting. The osapiens HUB is continuously

n Aus der vollständigen Stellenbeschreibung Firmenevents &nbsp; Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung OSAPIENS – Join us in building a sustainable future! 
At osapiens, we are committed to empowering businesses economically while promoting human rights and establishing ecologically sustainable and respons
ible corporate governance as a global standard. We support global enterprises in over 60 countries in integrating sustainability and positioning thems
elves for the future. To achieve this, we develop comprehensive SaaS solutions that create transparency and sustainable growth across the entire value
 chain, meet ESG requirements, and automate manual processes. Your Mission At osapiens, we are dedicated to providing innovative solutions that help o
ur customers achieve compliance with various ESG regulations through seamless data synchronization. Our SAP certified connector is a pivotal component
, enabling the integration between SAP source systems (including ECC and S/4HANA) and our cloud-based enterprise platform, the osapiens HUB. Join our 
dynamic team to contribute to the design and enhancement of this essential tool as well as consulting our customers in implementing it. As a (Senior) 
SAP Consultant and Developer, you will focus on designing, developing, and enhancing our SAP certified connector. This role is crucial in ensuring our
 customers can efficiently synchronize data between their SAP systems and the osapiens HUB. The connector facilitates data replication, aiding complia
nce with supply chain due diligence regulations and more. Your Responsibilities Understand business context for complex supply chain scenarions, as we
ll as the data flow within the osapiens HUB, as well as it’s API to ensure integration with SAP. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand
 client requirements and translate them into technical solutions. Design, develop, and enhance the SAP Connector addon for SAP ERP systems (ECC and S/
4), using: Object-oriented ABAP programming Customizing User Exits, BADIs, BTEs ABAP queries Manage new versions and releases of the SAP Connector add
on. Provide technical documentation and support for the SAP Connector addon. Act as Technical Consultant within Customer Onboardings: Guide clients th
rough the installation and configuration process. Ensure clients maximize the connector's capabilities. Provide support for custom adjustments. Collec
t requirements for future upgrades. Your Experience Advanced SAP ABAP Developer with expertise in: Object-oriented ABAP programming User Exits, BADIs,
 BTEs Database technology SAP HANA Version and transport management Understanding of RESTful APIs and JSON data format. Experience with SAP MM & SD Mo
dules. Proven ability to interact with customers to understand their needs and provide effective solutions. **Preferred Qualifications:** Strong probl
em-solving skills and ability to work independently. Excellent communication and teamwork abilities. Detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-q
uality solutions. Join us for this and more... A purpose-driven mission with and for global industry pioneers in tackling complex challenges Room for 
creativity through collaborative teamwork and an open communication culture Flexibility and team bonding with our hybrid work options Fuel for your gr
owth journey, both personally and professionally Sustainable mobility options, promoting eco-friendly commuting solutions Fun team events and outings 
with our global teams Inspiring workspaces in Mannheim and beyond And, of course, free drinks and snacks About us osapiens supports global companies f
rom various industries in establishing sustainability within their organizations and positioning themselves for the future. To achieve this, we develo
p holistic Software-as-a-Service solutions that create transparency and sustainable growth along the entire value chain, fulfill legal ESG requirement
s, and automate manual processes. osapiens aims to not only strengthen companies economically but also we also promote human rights and ecologically s
ustainable and responsible corporate governance as the global standard. We leverage our cloud-based technology platform, the 'osapiens HUB', and innov
ative technologies such as artificial intelligence to help companies seamlessly implement and automate compliance with international and national ESG 
laws and guidelines, including CSRD, EUDR, and CSDDD, and to further ensure accountable sustainability reporting. The osapiens HUB is continuously bei
ng developed and expanded to accomodate new solutions for evolving ESG regulations, as well as solutions for improved transparency and efficiency. osa
piens was founded in Germany in 2018 and we currently serve over 1,200 customers worldwide. The company is headquartered in Mannheim and has offices i

ns. This has three components: Distribution: Optimise logistics processes, strengthen customer relationships and sales opportunities and reduce a comp
anies environmental impact with our one-stop solution for last-mile distribution. Maintenance: Give a companies maintenance, asset and reliability tea

le reducing costs. Service: All-in-one service management software to maximise resource efficiency, improve first time fix rates, net promotor scores,

gineers to deploy functional safety solutions. Deliver collaterals such as training, reference methodology, and application notes to share best practi
ces and recommended usage. Key Qualifications & Experience Typically requires BSEE or MSEE with ideally 10 years of experience in SoC back-end design,

ence using ISO26262 products developed for semiconductors in automotive domain is preferred. Have strong motivation to improve semiconductor functiona

t Teilzeit Vollzeit &nbsp; Arbeitsort 85764 Oberschleißheim &nbsp; Leistungen Aus der vollständigen Stellenbeschreibung Betriebsarzt &nbsp; Vollständi
ge Stellenbeschreibung 102417 Full time 39 hrs./week Neuherberg near Munich Home Office Options We are Helmholtz Munich. In a rapidly changing world, 
we discover breakthrough solutions for better health. Our research is focused within the areas of metabolic health/diabetes, environmental health, mol
ecular targets and therapies, cell programming and repair, bioengineering, and computational health. We particularly excel in the fields of basic rese
arch, bioengineering, artificial intelligence, and technological development. Through this research, we build the foundations for medical innovation. 
Together with our partners, we seek to accelerate the transfer of our research, so that laboratory ideas can reach society and improve people’s qualit
y of life at the fastest rate possible. This is what drives us. Why not join us and make a difference? The (IFE) focuses on understanding the epigenet
ic mechanisms whereby cells and organisms integrate metabolic signals, establish cellular memory, and regulate plasticity. We leverage this knowledge 
to identify new epigenetic pathways for drug discovery. We use cutting-edge methods (multi-omics, single cell, live cell imaging, modelling, biochemis
try as well as various developmental, stem cell and cell biology systems) to predict, observe, and manipulate epigenetic processes. The Schneider grou
p is recruiting a Postdoc (f/m/x) to work on the interphase between chromatin biochemistry, epigenetics, RNA biology and epitranscriptomics. The appli
cant should have experience in the epigenetics and/or chromatin field, a good publication record and be motivated to shape her/his own project. The su
ccessful candidate will address a central question in epigenetics: how do epigenetic mechanisms control gene expression programs in single cells and h
ow can they be used to increase adaptation upon environmental stimuli, particularly in stem cells but also during cellular differentiation. Prof. Matt
hias Tschöp (Dr. Med., Dr. hc.), CEO of Helmholtz Munich: "We believe that excellent research requires a range of different perspectives. Diverse team
s reach better solutions and are more innovative in their research topics. Establishing our Diversity Management Strategy demonstrates our commitment 
to ensuring an appreciative company culture based on mutual respect. We are also implementing diversity-sensitive processes throughout our whole organ
ization." Your tasks The applicant will implement a combination of approaches, including different “omics” approaches and the development of novel sin
gle cell technologies. He/she will benefit from a vibrant scientific environment as well as the strong epigenetics, chromatin and AI communities on ca
mpus and in the Munich area. Your profile PhD in biology or a related field A very good publication record Experience in at least 2 of the following i
s essential: Chromatin or RNA biochemistry, ChIP-seq and RNA-seq techniques (including data analysis), Single cell approaches, RNA modifications, Mamm
alian tissue culture and cell manipulation Fluency in English Benefits Career Development: Postdoc program, scientific training & career center with t
ailored offers Recreation: 30 days annual leave, flexi days, plus public holidays International Staff Service: Support with the relocation and integra
tion process in Germany Health Promotion: Sports, company doctor, mental health initiatives Since 2005, we hold the TOTAL E-QUALITY award for exemplar
y action in the sense of an equal-opportunity organizational culture. Helmholtz Munich is actively committed to diversity and inclusion in practice an
d is sustainably committed to equality. The Diversity Charter has set itself the goal of promoting diversity in the world of work. By signing the char
ter, we commit ourselves to create an appreciative working environment for all employees. If you fulfil all the requirements, you may be eligible for 
a salary grade of up to E 13. Social benefits are based on the Collective Wage Agreement for Public-Sector Employees (TVöD). The position has an (init
ial) fixed term of 2 years but may be extended under certain circumstances. We are committed to promoting a culture of diversity and welcome applicati

was founded in Germany in 2018 and we currently serve over 1,200 customers worldwide. The company is headquartered in Mannheim and has offices in Berl
in, Cologne, Munich, Madrid, Paris, Amsterdam and London. We employ over 300 people from 60 countries. In 2022, we were honoured to receive the German

e Stellenbeschreibung Company Description We’re the world’s leading sports technology company, at the intersection between sports, media, and betting.
 More than 1,700 sports federations, media outlets, betting operators, and consumer platforms across 120 countries rely on our know-how and technology
 to boost their business. Job Description The history of Sportradar Virtual Gaming GmbH (SRVG) began in 2006 at the University of Bremen. The idea was
 born by scientists and students from the field of research on artificial intelligence: the development of virtual discoveries of "real sports". Our p
roducts can keep up with the latest generation of AAA games and our cutting-edge technologies as well as our drive to innovate the sports-tech industr
y made us became the market leader for web-based virtual sports today! To continue with this trajectory, we are looking for a Frontend Developer with 
an interest in further innovating the field of Sports & Gaming. Make the Sportradar team smarter, faster, and stronger. Come work for and shape one of
 the fastest-growing sports tech companies in the world. As a Full-stack/Frontend Developer, you’ll work together with a team of experienced designers
, product owners, and senior engineers to develop innovative and intuitive products. Ease of customisation, polished design, following the latest indu
stry trends, and abundant data are key areas that make our solutions stand out from the rest. THE CHALLENGE: You develop and maintain our Mobile First
 responsive front ends using TypeScript and industry-standard web frameworks and tools (e.g. React, Redux, Webpack). You develop and maintain our micr
oservice back ends using TypeScript, popular node libraries nest.js and TypeORM, and configure and use AWS services like ECS and RDS. You are eager to
 continuously develop yourself with modern web responsibilities and new design concepts. You have an eye for the optimized selection of our front ends
 for cross-browser compatibility and mobile devices. In cooperation with our product owners, you will evaluate the requirements and create technical c
oncepts. You will closely collaborate with other frontend developers, backend developers, project managers and the QA team on an interdisciplinary bas
is. Writing test-driven code, refactoring, fixing bugs, and using automated CI/CD pipelines are part of your daily routine. Qualifications Experienced
 full-stack/frontend software developer Good understanding of JavaScript language and web development principles. Experience with at least one client-
side JavaScript library or framework, ideally ReactJS. Good Angular and Typescript Detail-oriented and have an excellent sense of usability Team playe
r with excellent communication skills needed for successful cross-functional collaboration with your peers A strong sense of ownership, self-leadershi
p and responsibility as well as complex problem-solving skills Good communication skills, self-motivation, and the ability to work effectively with mi
nimal supervision Additional Information Work for and shape one of the fastest-growing digital sports companies in the world at the exciting intersect
ion of sports, media, betting and advertising. Be part of a highly motivated, innovative, and dynamic organization with people from more than 30 natio
nalities in our offices. A paid vacation of at least 26 days plus the 24th & 31st of Dec., as additional days off. An annual performance-related bonus
 Opportunity for hybrid working. Company pension plan, flexible voucher card, bike leasing and other health care benefits. Summer events and Christmas
 party Coffee, tea, fresh fruits and water in the office Internal management programs according to management level: Grow / Lead Like a Pro / Sportrad
ar e-Academy including team workshops with external trainers SPORTRADAR Sportradar is a global leader in understanding and leveraging the power of spo
rts data and digital content for its clients around the world. We provide cutting-edge solutions and services to media companies, bookmakers, sports f
ederations and state authorities. We are a truly international business employing over 3,500 people in more than 30 locations around the world. Our ra
pid growth has been driven by technological innovation alongside an understanding of our clients’ business needs. It is our commitment to excellent se
rvice, quality and reliability that makes us the trusted partner of more than 1,000 companies in over 100 countries. We occupy a unique position at th
e intersection of the sports, media and betting industries. This creates an exciting and fast-moving working environment that rewards creative thinkin
g and hard work. We are passionate about what we do, and we care passionately about our people. If you think you’re up to the challenge, come and help
 us to grow, innovate and develop! Shoot your shot in Sports and data! Don´t be a Spectator! Sportradar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are commi
tted to encourage diversity within our teams. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to among other things, your backgroun

bsp; Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung 102393 Full time 39 h/Woche Munich Home Office Options We are Helmholtz Munich. In a rapidly changing world, we 
discover breakthrough solutions for better health. Our research is focused within the areas of metabolic health/diabetes, environmental health, molecu
lar targets and therapies, cell programming and repair, bioengineering, and computational health. We particularly excel in the fields of basic researc
h, bioengineering, artificial intelligence, and technological development. Through this research, we build the foundations for medical innovation. Tog
ether with our partners, we seek to accelerate the transfer of our research, so that laboratory ideas can reach society and improve people’s quality o
f life at the fastest rate possible. This is what drives us. Why not join us and make a difference? The Institute of Epidemiology researches the inter
action of environment, lifestyle and genetics in the development and progression of various diseases. The focus is on cardiometabolic, respiratory and
 allergic diseases. The goal is to break new ground in prevention on an individual level as well as to enable evidence-based preventive health care th
rough improved environmental conditions. The research is mainly based on the KORA resources and the birth cohorts GINIplus and LISA. We are looking fo
r a highly motivated Postdoc with a strong publication record and a passion to develop and support our multidisciplinary team focused on allergy resea
rch. Prof. Matthias Tschöp (Dr. Med., Dr. hc.), CEO of Helmholtz Munich: "We believe that excellent research requires a range of different perspective
s. Diverse teams reach better solutions and are more innovative in their research topics. Establishing our Diversity Management Strategy demonstrates 
our commitment to ensuring an appreciative company culture based on mutual respect. We are also implementing diversity-sensitive processes throughout 
our whole organization." Your tasks Independent development and pursuit of research questions Analysis of complex longitudinal data, with allergic dis
eases and immunological endpoints Investigation of risk factors, and patterns for allergic diseases Manuscript preparation, and presentation of result
s Support in supervision of PhD and graduate students Contributing to different projects within the team and with external project partners Opportunit
y to write independent grant applications Your profile Doctoral degree in epidemiology or related fields, with prior knowledge in epidemiological rese
arch (PhD candidates close to defending their thesis are also welcome to apply) Preferably experience with respiratory diseases, allergies or immunolo
gy Thorough knowledge of statistical methods or data science and programming skills, using R software and associated packages Excellent writing and co
mmunication skills in English High motivation and commitment to pursue research projects independently as well as in collaboration Benefits Since 2005
, we hold the TOTAL E-QUALITY award for exemplary action in the sense of an equal-opportunity organizational culture. Helmholtz Munich is actively com
mitted to diversity and inclusion in practice and is sustainably committed to equality. The Diversity Charter has set itself the goal of promoting div
ersity in the world of work. By signing the charter, we commit ourselves to create an appreciative working environment for all employees. If you fulfi
l all the requirements, you may be eligible for a salary grade of up to E 13. Social benefits are based on the Collective Wage Agreement for Public-Se
ctor Employees (TVöD). The position has an (initial) fixed term of 2 years but may be extended under certain circumstances. We are committed to promot
ing a culture of diversity and welcome applications from talented people regardless of gender, cultural background, nationality, ethnicity, sexual ide
ntity, physical abilities, religion or age. Qualified applicants with physical disabilities will be given preference. If you have obtained a universit
y degree abroad, we will require further documents from you regarding the comparability of your degree. Interested in applying? If you have any questi
ons, feel free to contact Marie Standl, 089 3187 2952, who will be happy to help. Your application should include We are Helmholtz Munich. Why join us

NS – Join us in building a sustainable future! At osapiens, we are committed to empowering businesses economically while promoting human rights and es
tablishing ecologically sustainable and responsible corporate governance as a global standard. We support global enterprises in over 60 countries in i
ntegrating sustainability and positioning themselves for the future. To achieve this, we develop comprehensive SaaS solutions that create transparency

erations Efficiency department where our solutions are built to innovate and optimise the efficiency of a companies day-to-day operations. This has th
ree components: Distribution: Optimise logistics processes, strengthen customer relationships and sales opportunities and reduce a companies environme
ntal impact with our one-stop solution for last-mile distribution. Maintenance: Give a companies maintenance, asset and reliability team the tools and
 information they need to operate digital efficiently, increase asset availability, improve overall equipment effectiveness and TPM while reducing cos
ts. Service: All-in-one service management software to maximise resource efficiency, improve first time fix rates, net promotor scores, reduce energy,

he 35+ member Operations Efficiency team, helping us drive our efforts to deliver the most innovative solutions in our domain as a senior mobile devel
oper. Work across iOS, Android, and Windows platforms to design, implement, and test features for our offline-capable applications, serving field work
ers in distribution, field service, and maintenance. Lead and participate in the design and development of new features in coordination with the produ
ct team to meet the needs of our international customers. Collaborate closely with domain experts to define and develop optimized user experiences and
 innovative features for our mission-critical applications. Contribute to the enhancement of the mobile app architecture with a performance-minded app
roach, ensuring robustness and efficiency. Support continuous improvements in methodology and technology, maintain the toolchain and test environments
, and ensure high-quality standards by testing and reviewing code developed within the team. Align efforts with the product team and other stakeholder
s to ensure development goals are met and that project deliverables align with business objectives. Help increase automated test coverage to facilitat
e reliable and quicker iterations of feature releases, enhancing both process and technical aspects of development. Your Experience Must-have: 5+ year
s of experience with 3+ years focused on React Native Strong architecture knowledge (storage concepts, design, React Native specific) Strong knowledge

trong communication skills Nice-to-have: Experience with React Native for Windows Knowledge about native developments Experience in setting up full Re
act Native projects from scratch End-to-end testing experience Experience setting up/maintaining CI/CD pipelines Experience in guiding/leading other d
evelopers Join us for this and more... A purpose-driven mission tackling complex sustainability challenges whilst working alongside global industry pi
oneers Room for creativity through collaborative teamwork and an open communication culture Flexibility and team bonding with our hybrid work options

nts and outings with our global teams Inspiring HQ in Mannheim with 9 global offices If you're based in or visiting Mannheim, you can also benefit fro
m our sustainable subsidised lunch options About us osapiens supports global companies from various industries in establishing sustainability within t
heir organizations and positioning themselves for the future. To achieve this, we develop holistic Software-as-a-Service solutions that create transpa
rency and sustainable growth along the entire value chain, fulfill legal ESG requirements, and automate manual processes. osapiens aims to not only st
rengthen companies economically but also we also promote human rights and ecologically sustainable and responsible corporate governance as the global 
standard. We leverage our cloud-based technology platform, the 'osapiens HUB', and innovative technologies such as artificial intelligence to help com
panies seamlessly implement and automate compliance with international and national ESG laws and guidelines, including CSRD, EUDR, and CSDDD, and to f
urther ensure accountable sustainability reporting. The osapiens HUB is continuously being developed and expanded to accomodate new solutions for evol
ving ESG regulations, as well as solutions for improved transparency and efficiency. osapiens was founded in Germany in 2018 and we currently serve ov
er 1,200 customers worldwide. The company is headquartered in Mannheim and has offices in Berlin, Cologne, Munich, Madrid, Paris, Amsterdam and London
. We employ over 300 people from 60 countries. In 2022, we were honoured to receive the German Founder Award in the 'Rising Star' category. ** Please

aarbrücken &nbsp; Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung Saarbrücken, Deutschland Previous Next The CISPA Helmholtz Center for Information Security is looki
ng for multiple PhD Students and Postdoctoral Researchers who want to work with Andreas Zeller on his ERC-granted project “S3-Semantics of Software Sy
stems”. About the project In the S3 project, Andreas Zeller and his team will develop software bots that automatically test, debug and monitor softwar
e systems. Andreas is looking for: PhD Students who would like to work in one of the S3 areas Post-Docs who would like to combine their own independen
t research agenda with S3 techniques. For details on S3, check out the project website, which also includes the research proposal. What we offer Full 
time-gross base salary for E13 (starting from around 4.900,00€/month) according to the scale of the TVöD Bund (German Federal Employment Agreement) Co
mprehensive benefits package that includes health insurance coverage, 30 days of paid vacation and a robust pension scheme Possibilities for personal 
and professional growth, encompassing language classes, research support, as well as extracurricular and social activities Our onboarding team will pr
ovide you with all the necessary support for a seamless and successful start to your journey with us What we expect You have a Bachelor's, Master's or
 doctoral degree from a top-tier, research-oriented institution of higher education in a topic relevant to the project, including Software testing Sof
tware analysis Automated debugging and repair System security Applied machine learning You have demonstrated your ability to develop and execute a cut
ting-edge research agenda You are proficient in spoken and written English Work @CISPA We promote a flat hierarchy that encourages working together as
 a cohesive team and contributing one’s perspectives and ideas We have an English-speaking work environment; a command of German is not required for a
 successful career at CISPA, but if you want to learn German, we offer free courses We offer an exceptional research infrastructure and a robust scien
ce support system Our location Saarbrücken is a city with international flair (e.g., an International School and distinguished cuisine influenced by t
he proximity to the French border). The city is also known for its green spaces, parks and proximity to nature, providing opportunities for relaxation
 and outdoor activities. Application Process CISPA is dedicated to promoting diversity and inclusion in the field of Computer Science. As part of the 
Equal Opportunity Plan, we are actively working towards increasing the representation of women, minorities, and individuals with disabilities. We expl
icitly encourage women to apply. Applications of severely disabled candidates with equivalent qualifications will be given priority. We generally welc
ome applications from individuals irrespective of gender, nationality, ethnicity, social origin, religion/belief, disability, age, sexual orientation,
 or identity. In case of interest in working at CISPA, please press the "" button. Please upload your documents in PDF format on our application platf
orm. Applications via email cannot be accepted. For any questions regarding the application process, please contact us at jobs@cispa.saarland . ! Abou
t CISPA CISPA Helmholtz Center for Information Security is a German national Science Institution within the Helmholtz Association and provides a uniqu
e work environment that offers the advantage of a university department and a research laboratory alike. CISPA's mission is to rethink the digitized w
orld of the future from the ground on up an make it safer through innovative cutting-edge research. CISPA is committed to the highest international ac
ademic standards. We offer a world-class research environment that grants extensive resources to a wide range of researchers and constitutes an attrac
tive destination for the best talents and scientists from all countries. CISPA provides a highly international and diverse working environment, curren
tly hosting researchers of over 40 nationalities. Our headquarters are located in Saarbrücken, in the tri-border area of Germany, France and Luxembour
g. The CISPA campus is located close to Saarland University, which is known for its excellence in Computer Science, the Max Planck Institute for Infor
matics, the Max Planck Institute for Software Systems, and the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI). For more information about C

y rights can be found in our data privacy policy. ! &nbsp; Diesen Job melden

eitsweg &nbsp; Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung Engineer / IT Application Owner (f/m/x) Job ID: R0331130 Full/Part-Time: Full-time Regular/Temporary: 
Regular Listed: 2024-07-02 Location: Frankfurt Position Overview *English version below* Technology: Unsere Technology-Teams sind verantwortlich für d
ie komplette Informationstechnologie-Infrastruktur der Bank. Sie entwickeln und unterhalten Programme, die für das Geschäft der Bank erforderlich sind
. Die Teams arbeiten eng mit den Geschäftsbereichen und den anderen Infrastruktureinheiten daran, die IT-Systeme zu modernisieren, um Komplexität zu r
eduzieren, Risiken zu minimieren und Wachstum zu ermöglichen. Die Deutsche Bank versteht sich als Technologieunternehmen, das mit neuen Ideen Marktant
eile gewinnen und führend im digitalen Bankgeschäft sein kann. Wir investieren in allen Unternehmensbereichen erheblich in digitale Technologien, dami
t unsere Kunden uns schneller und flexibler über alle Kanäle erreichen können, damit wir Daten bestmöglich nutzen und die Bank durch die Automatisieru
ng von Prozessen effizienter und besser steuerbar machen können. Wir arbeiten zudem weltweit mit externen Partnern zusammen, darunter mit jungen Unter
nehmen wie FinTechs und Technologiespezialisten, um innovative Lösungen für unsere Kunden zu entdecken und einzuführen. Im Bereich Technology der Bank
 zu arbeiten heißt, den Blick nach vorne zu richten und die Zukunft zu gestalten. Wir setzen auf Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter, die aus technologis
chen Trends und Entwicklungen wirtschaftlich tragfähige Ideen ableiten, die unser Geschäft neu gestalten und unseren Kunden einen Mehrwert bieten. Dab
ei geht es immer darum, die Anforderungen von Kunden, Aufsichtsbehörden und Märkten gleichermaßen zu erfüllen. Die Position ist im Bereich Corporate B
ank - Transaction Surveillance Technology angesiedelt. Unser Ziel ist es unsere Kunden und die Deutsche Bank gegen Verstöße von Richtlinien und untern
ehmensschädigenden Geschäftspraktiken im Zahlungsverkehr zu schützen. Daher entwickeln wir innovative Softwarelösungen zur Überprüfung von regulatoris
chen und fachlichen Anforderungen in Echtzeit. Rolle: Zur Stärkung unseres Entwicklungsteams suchen wir einen ITAO (IT Application Owner). Die Rolle v
erfügt über ein besonders tiefes und breites Fachwissen zu Entwicklung & Wartung von Anwendungen; berät umfassend bei Sicherheit und Stabilität von An
wendungen und schlägt geeignete Technologien vor. Aufgaben: Design und Entwicklung von Komponenten einer Echtzeit-Anwendung basierend auf einer Micros
ervices-Architektur. Implementierung und Erfüllung von Bankrichtlinien (Namenskonventionen, Verschlüsselung, Sicherheitseinstellungen, Kapazität, Verf
ügbarkeit und andere nicht-funktionale Anforderungen). Identifizierung und Koordination von Abhängigkeiten im Zusammenhang mit Release-Aktivitäten für
 die Nicht-Produktionsumgebung sowie in der Produktionsumgebung. Durchführung von Machbarkeitsstudien, Kostenschätzungen, Code-Überprüfungen nach dem 
Vier-Augen-Prinzip sowie Problem- und Ursachenanalyse. Evaluierung und Identifizierung von Risikominderungspotenzialen, auch in Bezug auf mehrere Aspe
kte wie Design, Implementierung, Integration und Datenqualität. Level-3-Support für technische Infrastrukturkomponenten (z. B. Datenbanken, Middleware
 und Benutzeroberflächen). Gegebenenfalls verwaltet er die Wartung von Anwendungen und führt geplante technische Änderungen gemäß agilen Prinzipien/Pr
ozessen durch. Anforderungen: Bachelor of Science-Abschluss an einer anerkannten Hochschule oder Universität mit Schwerpunkt Informatik oder Softwaret
echnik (oder gleichwertig) – mit Nebenfach Finanzen, Mathematik oder Ingenieurwesen. Ausgeprägte analytische Problemlösungsfähigkeiten, um komplexe Pr
obleme zu durchdringen, zu strukturieren und verständlich darzustellen. Fundierte Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit den folgenden oder ähnlichen
 Technologien, Plattformen und Tools: JSE, JMS, XML, JSON, Apache Camel, Drools, SpringBoot, Hazelcast, Docker, RedHat OpenShift, Google Cloud, Kafka,
 Maven, Git, Eclipse, Confluence und JIRA. Gute Kenntnisse in folgenden Themen: Design Patterns, Enterprise Integration Patterns, REST, Microservices,
 Monitoring Tools. Erfahrung in agiler Entwicklung ist sehr wünschenswert (SAFe/SCRUM/Kanban). Know-how oder Erfahrung in einem oder mehreren der folg
enden Themen wären eine perfekte Ergänzung: Distributed Caching, Real-Time Streaming, Data Analytics, Graph Databases und Artificial Intelligence. Gut
e Fähigkeit, in virtuellen Teams und in Matrixorganisationen zu arbeiten. Fähigkeit, Informationen zu teilen und Fachwissen und Erfahrung weiterzugebe
n sowie in einem schnelllebigen Umfeld mit konkurrierenden und wechselnden Prioritäten mit ständigem Fokus auf die Lieferung zu arbeiten. Fließende En
glischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift – Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil. Was wir bieten Wir bieten eine breite Palette von Leistungen, die all Ihre 
beruflichen und persönlichen Bedürfnisse abdecken. Emotional ausgeglichen Eine positive Haltung hilft uns, die Herausforderungen des Alltags zu meiste
rn – beruflich wie privat. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beratung in schwierigen Lebenssituationen und Angeboten zur Förderung mentaler Gesundheit
. Körperlich fit Mit Angeboten zur Aufrechterhaltung Ihrer persönlichen Gesundheit und einem förderlichen beruflichen Umfeld hilft Ihnen die Bank, kör
perlich fit zu bleiben. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie umfangreichen Check-up Untersuchungen, Impfangeboten und Beratung zur gesunden Lebensführung
. Sozial vernetzt Der Austausch mit anderen eröffnet uns neue Perspektiven, bringt uns beruflich wie persönlich voran und stärkt unser Selbstvertrauen
 und Wohlbefinden. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Unterstützung durch den pme Familienservice, das FitnessCenter Job, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle (
bspw. Teilzeit, Jobtandem, hybrides Arbeiten) sowie einer umfangreichen Kultur der Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Teilhabe. Finanziell abgesichert Di
e Bank sichert Sie nicht nur während Ihrer aktiven Karriere, sondern auch für die Zukunft finanziell ab und unterstützt Ihre Flexibilität sowie Mobili
tät – egal ob privat oder beruflich. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beitragsplänen für Altersvorsorge, Bankdienstleistungen für Mitarbeiter*innen, 
Firmenfahrrad oder dem Deutschlandticket. Da die Benefits je nach Standort geringfügig variieren, gehen Sie bitte bei konkreten Fragen auf Ihre Recrui
terin zu. Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten. Bei Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess steht Ihnen Stefanie Schumann gerne zur Verfügung. K
ontakt: Stefanie Schumann +49 1516 1059412 ...........................................................................................................
................ Technology: Our technology teams are responsible for the bank's entire information technology infrastructure. They develop and mainta
in programs that are required for the bank's business. The teams work closely with the business units and other infrastructure units to modernize IT s
ystems in order to reduce complexity, minimize risks and enable growth. Deutsche Bank sees itself as a technology company that can gain market share w
ith new ideas and be a leader in digital banking. We invest significantly in digital technologies in all areas of the company so that our customers ca
n reach us faster and more flexibly across all channels, so that we can use data in the best possible way and make the bank more efficient and easier 
to manage by automating processes. We also work with external partners worldwide, including young companies such as FinTechs and technology specialist
s, to discover and introduce innovative solutions for our customers. Working in the bank's technology department means looking ahead and shaping the f
uture. We rely on employees who derive economically viable ideas from technological trends and developments that reshape our business and offer our cu
stomers added value. It is always about meeting the requirements of customers, regulators and markets alike. The position is located in the Corporate 
Bank - Transaction Surveillance Technology area. Our goal is to protect our customers and Deutsche Bank against violations of guidelines and business 
practices in payment transactions that are damaging to the company. We therefore develop innovative software solutions to check regulatory and technic
al requirements in real time. Role: To strengthen our development team, we are looking for an ITAO (IT Application Owner). The role has particularly d
eep and broad expertise in the development and maintenance of applications; provides comprehensive advice on the security and stability of application
s and suggests suitable technologies. Tasks: Design and development of components of a real-time application based on a microservices architecture. Im
plementation and fulfillment of banking guidelines (naming conventions, encryption, security settings, capacity, availability and other non-functional
 requirements). Identify and coordinate dependencies related to release activities for the non-production environment as well as in the production env
ironment. Conduct feasibility studies, cost estimates, code reviews using the four-eyes principle, and problem and root cause analysis. Evaluate and i
dentify risk mitigation potentials, including across multiple aspects such as design, implementation, integration, and data quality. Level 3 support f
or technical infrastructure components (e.g. databases, middleware, and user interfaces). Where appropriate, manage application maintenance and implem
ent planned technical changes according to agile principles/processes. Requirements: Bachelor of Science degree from an accredited college or universi
ty with a focus on Computer Science or Software Engineering (or equivalent) - with a minor in Finance, Mathematics, or Engineering. Strong analytical 
problem-solving skills to penetrate, structure, and present complex problems in an understandable way. Solid knowledge and practical experience with t
he following or similar technologies, platforms and tools: JSE, JMS, XML, JSON, Apache Camel, Drools, SpringBoot, Hazelcast, Docker, RedHat OpenShift,
 Google Cloud, Kafka, Maven, Git, Eclipse, Confluence and JIRA. Good knowledge of the following topics: Design Patterns, Enterprise Integration Patter
ns, REST, Microservices, Monitoring Tools. Experience in agile development is highly desirable (SAFe/SCRUM/Kanban). Know-how or experience in one or m
ore of the following topics would be a perfect addition: Distributed Caching, Real-Time Streaming, Data Analytics, Graph Databases and Artificial Inte
lligence. Good ability to work in virtual teams and in matrix organizations. Ability to share information and impart expertise and experience and to w
ork in a fast-paced environment with competing and changing priorities with a constant focus on delivery. Fluent written and spoken English – knowledg
e of German is an advantage. What we offer We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and p
rofessional needs. Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and private
ly. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings. Physically thriving We support you in staying phy
sically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives

tellungsart Vollzeit &nbsp; Arbeitsort Wiesbaden &nbsp; Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung Primary Function According to the World Health Organization, 
approximately 422 million people have diabetes today and by 2045 the number is projected to rise to 700 million people. The Abbott Diabetes Care FreeS
tyle Libre continuous glucose monitor (CGM) sensor and customer experience delivers patient-centered solutions and empathetic experiences critical to 
helping people with diabetes understand how to manage their disease-state and live life to the fullest. As the International IT Business Relationship 
Director, you will play a pivotal role in our global go-to-market business strategy for our International Division (EMEA, APAC, LATAM). Reporting dire
ctly to the Global Commercial IT Director, your responsibilities will include collaborating with cross-functional teams, ensuring global business and 
IT strategy seamlessly drive solutions and the portfolio of programs, projects, and applications support our business growth, engage health care profe
ssionals, and enhance patient care. Responsible for the IT portfolio associated with the International region (EMEA, APAC, LATAM) of the ADC Commercia

ring/showcasing business value. You will ensure the portfolio enhances organizational strategy through partnership with the Abbott IT Delivery organiz
ation in helping to guide architecture, portfolio and program management while influencing engagement with the right software or service providers. A 
steady and trusted advisor, partnering closely with Vice President, Divisional Vice President and 12+ Business Directors and Country Managers, you and

and global eCommerce, skillfully applying your knowledge of business needs and enterprise IT strategies to proactively identify areas of opportunity a
nd shape demand in anticipation of future strategic business capabilities. Core Job Responsibilities Strategic Business Partnership Regional Alignment

orities, and pain points. Align your communication to address these areas. Provide concise, relevant updates that highlight progress, challenges, and 
potential solutions. Focus on outcomes and impact. Anticipate questions or concerns executives might have. Be proactive in addressing them before they

ivery teams, considering local market dynamics, regulations, customer preferences and future omnichannel scaling. Drive consistency in user experience

ration across functions. Break down silos and optimize cohesive effectiveness while enabling seamless alignment of technology with business goals. Con
flict Resolution: Skillfully mediate and resolve conflicts within cross-functional teams and executive alignment, fostering collaboration, understandi
ng and positive outcomes. Business Needs Assessment: Collaborate with regional business stakeholders to identify technology needs, pain points, and gr
owth areas. Translate business requirements into actionable IT initiatives. Innovation Advocacy: Champion innovation by staying abreast of industry tr
ends, emerging technologies, and best practices. Propose innovative solutions that drive operational efficiency and competitive advantage. Leverage AI

o identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making, predictive modeling, and process optimization. Translate business needs into actionable insi
ghts, leveraging AI algorithms and analytics tools to enhance organizational performance and drive value creation. IT Strategy and Execution Strategic

across regions and allocate resources effectively. Portfolio & Program Management: Oversee the successful delivery of IT projects, ensuring they meet 
business goals, timelines, and quality standards. Collaborate with project managers, architects, and development teams. Vendor Management: Evaluate an
d collaborate with the Abbott IT Delivery team to select external vendors for IT services and solutions. In collaboration with the Abbott IT Delivery 
team, negotiate contracts and manage vendor relationships. Change Management and Communication Change Leadership: Drive change management initiatives 
related to technology adoption, process improvements, and organizational transformation. Foster a culture of continuous learning and adaptability. Sta
keholder Communication: Communicate IT strategies, project updates, and performance metrics to senior leadership and regional teams. Ensure transparen

ams to ensure data protection and privacy compliance controls are in place to protect patient data and Abbott assets. Mitigate risks related to data b
reaches and regulatory requirements. Business Continuity Planning: Develop and maintain robust business continuity plans for critical IT systems. Test
 and refine disaster recovery procedures. Budget Management Oversee and control International team’s IT budgets, Business Relationship Management (BRM
) team budgets, program and project budgets, and project capital requests for capital expenditures and ROI. Continually look for opportunities for cos
t reductions and cost avoidance. Supervisory/Management Responsibilities Responsible for all aspects of people leadership for the BRM team of 7 direct

g, discipline and separation. Determine necessary skill sets and confront and manage people issues in a constructive and timely manner. Responsible fo
r the overall morale of the team and promoting a cohesive positive attitude. Establishes staffing/resource plans determining appropriate mix of sourci
ng opportunities to ensure overall organizational effectiveness. Minimum Experience / Training Required Minimum of 12 years of progressive experience 
in IT leadership roles, preferably within a large or mid-sized multi-national healthcare or medical devices organization. Strong organizational skills

lls. Proven track record of successfully managing complex IT projects across diverse regions. Strong understanding of diabetes care, medical devices,
